body.p: The Board considered suggestions that recognising proceeds before intended use and related cost in profit or loss might not provide useful information to users of financial statements. Those holding this view suggested that such sales proceeds—and the related margin—may have little predictive value because:

li.p: the sales proceeds are generally non-recurring and are not necessarily an output of an entity’s ordinary activities; and
the cost of items produced would not include depreciation of the item of property, plant and equipment—because depreciation of that asset begins when it is available for use.
